intro: Geraniospermum rodneyanum, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its unique floral structure and ecological role make it an important species in its native environment.
